entities.name: CDs
entities.description: Compact Discs (CDs) are digital optical disc data storage formats used for storing and playing music. They were a dominant format in the music industry before the rise of digital streaming services.

entities.name: single song
entities.description: A single piece of music that can be listened to independently within an album.

entities.name: SOCIAL MEDIA
entities.description: Social media platforms have facilitated the sharing and discovery of music, contributing to the expansion of artists' reach and the music industry's digital transformation

entities.name: audience
entities.description: The worldwide group of music consumers and listeners.

entities.name: data and analytics
entities.description: Valuable metrics and information derived from user interactions.

entities.name: Music Industry
entities.description: The music industry encompasses the production, distribution, and consumption of music. It includes various stakeholders such as artists, record labels, and consumers.

entities.name: consumption
entities.description: The act of listening to recorded music through streaming platforms.

entities.name: Fans
entities.description: Fans are individuals who support and follow the work of artists. They often engage with the artist"s music, attend concerts, and participate in fan communities.

entities.name: Industry Stakeholders
entities.description: Industry stakeholders include record labels, artists, and other professionals involved in the music industry. They have raised concerns about the sustainability of the current business model.

entities.name: music business model
entities.description: The music business model refers to the economic structure and practices that govern how revenue is generated and distributed in the music industry.

entities.name: Debates About Fair Compensation
entities.description: The debate about fair compensation for artists in the streaming era is a significant social issue. It revolves around the low royalty rates paid by streaming platforms.

entities.name: recommendations algorithms
entities.description: Recommendation systems that personalize music based on user preferences.

entities.name: music consumption
entities.description: Music consumption refers to the ways in which people listen to and enjoy music, including through various formats such as streaming services, physical media like CDs and vinyl records, and other methods.

entities.name: One-Time Payment
entities.description: A one-time payment is a form of compensation where artists receive a single lump sum for their work.

entities.name: tastes
entities.description: Individual's favored genres, artists, and styles of music.

entities.name: technology evolution
entities.description: The development and change of technology over time.

entities.name: Personalized playlists
entities.description: Personalized playlists are adaptive music collections generated based on individual user preferences, enhancing listening experience through tailored recommendations.

entities.name: Playlist
entities.description: A playlist is a collection of songs curated by users or music platforms.

entities.name: Recommendation Algorithms
entities.description: Algorithms that analyze user data to suggest music based on their preferences and listening history.

entities.name: Album
entities.description: An album is a collection of songs, typically released together by an artist or band.

entities.name: accessibility
entities.description: The ease and ease with which content can be accessed and shared online.

entities.name: Artist
entities.description: An artist is a person who creates music, often performing and recording songs.

entities.name: reach of artists and their music
entities.description: The increased exposure and distribution of artists' works through digital platforms and social media.

entities.name: listening experience
entities.description: A personalized and customized audio enjoyment based on individual preferences.

entities.name: technology
entities.description: Technology refers to the application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, including the development and use of tools, machines, methods, and systems.

entities.name: entire album
entities.description: A collection of multiple songs sold as a single package.

entities.name: Music Sharing
entities.description: The act of sharing music with others, often through digital means.

entities.name: challenges
entities.description: Issues and difficulties faced by users and content creators on music streaming platforms.

entities.name: CRITICS
entities.description: Critics are individuals who raise concerns about the impact of music streaming services on the music industry, particularly regarding artist compensation and the sustainability of the business model

entities.name: platforms
entities.description: Online platforms that allow access to music and other media.

entities.name: royalties
entities.description: A system where artists are compensated based on usage or plays of their content.

entities.name: publishers
entities.description: Publishers manage the rights to musical compositions and lyrics. They ensure that creators are compensated for their work.

entities.name: styles
entities.description: Diverse forms and expressions within music

entities.name: individual tracks
entities.description: Individual audio recordings that can be streamed.

entities.name: traditional record sales
entities.description: Traditional record sales refer to the sale of physical music formats such as CDs and vinyl records, which were dominant in the music industry before the rise of digital streaming.

attributes.Dominance Period: Before the rise of digital streaming

entities.name: millions of songs
entities.description: An extensive collection of available audio tracks

entities.name: INDEPENDENT AND EMERGING ARTISTS
entities.description: Independent and emerging artists are musicians who have not yet achieved widespread recognition or commercial success, but create and distribute their music through various platforms including online streaming services.

entities.name: artist compensation
entities.description: Artist compensation refers to the financial remuneration received by musicians and other performers for their work.

entities.name: Data Analytics
entities.description: Valuable data and analytics that help artists understand their audience better.

entities.name: APPLE MUSIC
entities.description: Apple Music is a music streaming service that offers a large library of songs and has contributed to the shift in music consumption from physical to digital formats

entities.name: Diverse Music Genres
entities.description: A wide range of musical genres and styles are available in the modern music landscape, catering to diverse audience preferences.

entities.name: major label backing
entities.description: Major label backing refers to the support and resources provided by large music record labels to artists, including financial investment, marketing, distribution, and promotion.

attributes.Historical Dominance: In the past, major labels dominated the music market through physical formats like CDs and vinyl records.
attributes.Impact on Accessibility: Major label backing was historically necessary for artists to reach a wide audience due to the control of distribution channels.

entities.name: music
entities.description: Music is an art form and cultural activity whose medium is sound organized in time. It has been a significant part of human culture throughout history.

attributes.Accessibility: More accessible to a wider audience through streaming services
attributes.Diversity: Wider range of genres and styles available due to streaming

entities.name: established artists
entities.description: Experienced and well-established performers in the music industry.

entities.name: music discovery
entities.description: Process of finding new music through social media platforms

entities.name: sharing through social media
entities.description: The process of sharing content online, particularly through social media platforms.

entities.name: new artists and genres
entities.description: New artists and genres are emerging musicians or styles that listeners may not have previously known.

entities.name: Music Library
entities.description: A vast collection of songs and podcasts available for streaming.

entities.name: LISTENERS
entities.description: Listeners are individuals who consume music, and have benefited from the increased accessibility and personalization offered by music streaming services

entities.name: PANDORA
entities.description: Pandora is a music streaming service that has played a role in the transformation of the music industry by providing a platform for music discovery and consumption

entities.name: users
entities.description: Individuals who use music discovery tools.
